item.title: Help With Getting A New Server Online
item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

I get this error message when No-ip is open or closed with the server open and closed I think I may have a few options incorrect on the portforward set up. I have followed the guide very closely but it seems it does not work. Any suggestions/ can you troubleshoot it through TV? I hate to ask but I am getting very frustrated.

Error: I could not see your service on 184.147.113.13 on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused

When uTorrent is open it says success Should I change my uTorrent port or just run the server with uTorrent open. I heard the latter can block the port?

I have to go to school until about 3pm EST tomorrow so if you can think of anything that can help it would be greatly appreciated,
either post it here or email it to chris___33@hotmail.com (that’s 3 underscores)

Thanks,
Chris

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

I cannot seem to find anywhere to put it in this is the only thing I can find
public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip
throws IOException
{
if(signlink.mainapp != null)
return signlink.opensocket(i);
else
return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(Gui.server), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui

item.title: Help With Getting A New Server Online
item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

Hello, I am new to coding servers but have some experience coding rs bots in the past(so I am not entirely new at this). I have downloaded a client and source. I have made some minor changes to the look of the loading screen and added some new commands etc. The problem is when I upload the client to mediafire and my friends download it they cannot connect to the server and they get the error. Server is offline. I have done the basic port forwarding with my gateway. I have a no-ip and have put it in the gui.java it looks like this:System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “submissionpkz.no-ip.org”;

and run my personal client looking like this
System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “127.0.0.1”;

I Have heard that in the class.java you are supposed to change the ip but I have read through the entire code/script and cant find it.
Any Help would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: Help With Getting A New Server Online
